ojc.bain.neuron.rate

Class NeuronCollectionWithBias<C extends NeuronConfiguration>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • ojc.bain.base.ComponentCollection
        • ojc.bain.base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • ojc.bain.base.NeuronCollection<C>
            • ojc.bain.neuron.rate.NeuronCollectionWithBias<C>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ComponentConfigurationListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClampedLinearNeuronCollection, LinearNeuronCollection, SigmoidNeuronCollection

    public abstract class NeuronCollectionWithBias<C extends NeuronConfiguration>
extends NeuronCollection<C>
    A base for (typically rate-based encoding type) neurons that include a bias in the activation. Sub-classes must add the bias to the relevant calculations, for example with neuronInputs[neuronID] += bias[neuronID]; in the NeuronCollection.run() method.
    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Field Detail

      • bias

        protected double[] bias
        The bias value for each neuron.

      • biasModified

        protected boolean biasModified
        Flag to indicate if any of the bias values have been modified since the last step. This is used to determine if we need to put() the bias array/buffer when using OpenCL.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuronCollectionWithBias

        public NeuronCollectionWithBias()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to generate pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class NeuronCollection<C extends NeuronConfiguration>

      • getBias

        public double getBias(int neuronIndex)
        Get the bias the given neuron.

      • setBias

        public void setBias(int neuronIndex,
           double b)
        Set the bias for the given neuron.

      • step

        public void step()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Update the model over one time step. Sub-classes should call this super method. The step() method will invoke the overridden run() method which defines the Aparapi kernel. This method sets ComponentCollection.stateVariablesStale and ComponentCollection.outputsStale to true.
        Overrides:
        step in class NeuronCollection<C extends NeuronConfiguration>
